main event: On July 8th, 1958, in Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania, civilians reported a sighting of a small, yellowish-green object with slow southwest movement.
interesting points: The object was described as round and small, with a yellowish-green color.
The observation took place at dusk with a ground visual using binoculars.
The duration of the observation was 50 seconds, with the object moving at a slow but fast southwest speed.
The report mentions insufficient data to properly evaluate the observation and indicates the possibility of it being an aircraft.
There were no actions taken as a result of this sighting.
sighted object: a small, yellowish-green object with slow southwest movement
